newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Small firm apprenticeships to double - Australia.
newsitem.headline: Small firm apprenticeships to double - Australia.

text.p: The Australian government said on Thursday it expected to double the number of apprentices and trainees employed by small business through group training schemes by injecting an extra A$22 million into group training by the year 2000.

Training Minister David Kemp said the group training companies -- agencies which take on apprentices and trainees and find a number of firms to share their employment -- had agreed to double numbers to 40,000.
"The new national apprenticeship system will provide thousands of young Australians with quality training that will lead to real jobs," Kemp said in a statement.
"It will also help provide bussinesses with a competitive edge in overseas markets," he said.
He said the federal, state and territory governments provide A$17 million a year for group training of apprentices and trainees.
Australia's 127 group training companies hire 20,000 apprentices and trainees, out of a total 160,000 around the country.
